intro: Tithymalus dobrogensis, commonly known as the Dobrogian tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
